summary: This is a forwarded email chain from August 8-9, 2019, regarding a potential lead in the Epstein investigation. Geoffrey Berman, then U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), relays a tip about a 'NY-based Canadian' who may have relevant information, suggesting an agent make contact.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, relaying a tip from a contact about a potential informant with information relevant to the Epstein case.

connections.description: Berman's friend from NJ was contacted by the NJ doctor/businessman, who is the source of the tip about the Canadian informant.
The NJ doctor/businessman claims to know a NY-based Canadian who has information relevant to Epstein and wants to connect them with the SDNY.

events.title: Tip relayed about potential informant
events.description: Geoffrey Berman emails colleagues about a tip received via a friend concerning a 'NY-based Canadian' who may have information relevant to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 9, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019, indicating active investigation follow-up.
Geoffrey Berman, then the U.S. Attorney for SDNY, was personally involved in fielding tips about the case.
The tip concerns a 'somewhat sketchy' NY-based Canadian who supposedly has relevant information, suggesting the pursuit of various leads.
The communication shows internal protocol for handling potential informants, with a suggestion to 'have an agent on the line.'
The document is a forwarded chain, indicating the information was being circulated among relevant officials.
